results.title: Rembrandt: painter of man
results.creator_credit: Bert Haanstra Film Productions, Coronet Instructional Films and Bert Haanstra
results.brief_description: Presents selected canvases gathered from twenty-nine museums in twelve countries. These paintings highlight Rembrandt’s use of light and shadow, and his ability to express compassion for his subjects.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bert Haanstra Film Productions, Coronet Instructional Films and Bert Haanstra

results.title: Rembrandt: draughtsman
results.creator_credit: Nederlandse Omroep Stichting, Rijksmuseum Amsterdam, Hans Nieman, Tina De Vrij and Kees van Langeraad
results.brief_description: The paintings of Dutch 17th century painter Rembrandt van Rijn, are world famous, but a large number of his beautiful drawings have never been seen by the public. This film explores this rich oeuvre, setting it in the context of Rembrandt’s life, his work, his contemporaries and the society of 17th century Holland.

results.title: Rembrandt's - The Three Crosses
results.creator_credit: Balfour Films, Arts Council of Great Britain and Dudley Shaw Ashton
results.brief_description: A detailed account of the engraving of the original plate for Rembrandt’s celebrated print; the artist’s experimental use of different papers and methods of inking, and the later re-working of the plate. Commentary written and spoken by Christopher White.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Balfour Films, Arts Council of Great Britain and Dudley Shaw Ashton

results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Kip Porteous

results.title: Remain
results.brief_description: In her 2018 2-channel video work Remain, Iranian born Melbourne artist Hoda Afshar works with several of the refugees who remain on Manus Island, encouraging the men to ‘re-enact their narratives with their own bodies and [gives] them autonomy to narrate their own stories’.

constellations_other.name: Seeking asylum
constellations_other.description: Chauka Please Tell Us the Time was covertly filmed on a smartphone inside the Manus Island Detention Centre and sent via WhatsApp.

results.description: In her 2018 2-channel video work Remain, Iranian born Melbourne artist Hoda Afshar works with several of the refugees who remain on Manus Island, encouraging the men to ‘re-enact their narratives with their own bodies and [gives] them autonomy to narrate their own stories’.

results.title: Reluctant warriors - 1939
results.brief_description: A summary of events in Britain in 1939 at the beginning of World War II, including the dramatic radio announcement of the declaration of war, evacuation of children from the cities, landing of the British Expeditionary Force in France and the actual beginning of the War at sea. Narrated by Sir Michael Redgrave. Written by Peter Baylis.

results.title: Release prints
results.brief_description:
1. Wall to Wall Wool - Documents the process of wool carpet production from design illustrations of a bunch of flowers to the manufacture of finished carpet with similar design. Primarily focuses on the many types of machinery used to create the carpet. Contains nice images of a carpet-making factory, specifically the colourful flower-patterned carpet juxtaposed within an industrial backdrop. Good ‘The End’. (12m 44sec)

  2. Melbourne: Festival City - Made by the Victorian Tourist Development Authority in the 1960s. Essentially an ad for Melbourne, focusing on the ‘highly popular’ Moomba Festival. Great images of large crowds watching the Moomba parade as well as having fun on rides, watching watersports and eating/drinking (including Latte drinkers). Also shows the ‘recently completed’ Sydney Myer Music Bowl, footage of a game of football at the MCG and highlights Melbourne as the ‘Fashion Capital’. Nice closing shot of the city, focusing on St. Pauls and a Fed Square-less Flinders St, as well as the Yarra. Good titles and ‘The End’. (10 mins)

  3. Hydatids - Australian Wool Bureau production. Highlights the dangers of Hydatid disease and the ease of which it can be both contracted and negated. This includes washing hands after having contact with dogs and boiling all sheep offal before feeding it to dogs. Contains footage of a farmer gutting a sheep and cute diagrams of how the hydatids disease can spread from sheep to dogs to humans. (10 mins)

results.title: Relax it's just sex [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Millivres Multimedia, Forefront Films, Sneak Preview Entertainment, Steven J Wolfe, Megan O'Neill, Harold Warren and P.J. Castellaneta
results.brief_description: Relax its just sex is about a group of twenty/thirty-something friends - a mix of straight, lesbian, bi-sexual and homosexual - sorting through the complexities of their relationships with various lovers and friends. Tara (Jennifer Tilly) is the mother hen of the group who keeps them all together; Vincey is the only single one and longs for a partner; Sarina and Megan break up when Megan sleeps with a man; Robin is their friend who helps Sarina out. On the whole the film has a comic tone - the opening sequence cautions the audience that when it comes to homosexuality there is nothing to be afraid of. Nevertheless, the film soon turns tragic as it delves into issues such as AIDS and gay bashing. Characters frequently address the camera, explaining their inner thoughts and feelings about their current situation as well as musing on the nature of love and sex. With at least ten principal characters, some are not given enough screen time to develop beyond caricature and at times the film is stagnated by its talkiness. Despite these flaws however, “Relax its just sex” is by turns amusing, thought provoking and quite sexy.
